p: Studies on the antimicrobial activity of monoterpenes showed that only the (+)-enantiomers of α-pinene and β-pinene had antibacterial activity against C. albicans, Cryptococcus neoformans, Rhizopus oryzae, and MRSA [ 27]. In our experiments, (±)-α-pinene and (−)-β-pinene demonstrated lower activity compared to unfractionated F. ovina EOs, and (±)-sabinene also had low activity. The highest percentage of the (+)-enantiomer of β-pinene was in FOEO Sfr. Although it could be suggested that this enantiomer was responsible for the antibacterial activity of unfractionated F. ovina EOs, some active EO samples (FOEO Rfl, FOEO Rfr, and FOEO Sfr) had lower levels of β-pinene (1.9 and 1.5%, respectively) ( Table 1), which is not consistent with this conclusion. Additionally, α-pinene is present at high levels in F. akitschkensis EOs, yet these EOs had no antibacterial activity [ 12]. Thus, it is unlikely that (±)-α-pinene and (−)-β-pinene contribute significantly to the overall antibacterial activity observed.
